ARABIC: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We created them and made their joints strong, and if We wish We can replace them with others like them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We created them and fixed their bones and joints; and We could replace them when We like with others like them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We created them and strengthened their joints; and whenever We wish, We can change their faces entirely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have created them and have given them strength. Had We wanted, We could have replaced them with another people like them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It is We Who created them, and strengthened their skeleton; and We can replace them with others like them, whenever We will.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It is We Who created them, and We have made them of strong build. And when We will, We can replace them with others like them with a complete replacement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: We created them and made firm their make, and when We please We will bring in their place the likes of them by a change.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We created them, and We strengthened their joints; and, when We will, We shall exchange their likes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We, even We, created them, and strengthened their frame. And when We will, We can replace them, bringing others like them in their stead.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It was We who created them and made their constitution strong, but if We wish we can replace them with others like them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: It it We Who creared them and made them firm of make. And whenever We list, We can replace them with others like Unto them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We created them and strengthened their joints, and We will replace them with others like them whenever We like.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It is We Who created them, and We have made their joints strong; but, when We will, We can substitute the like of them by a complete change.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: It is We Who created them, and We have made them of strong built. And when We will, We can replace them with others like them with a complete replacement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We created them, and We strengthened their joints, but, when We will, We shall indeed exchange their likes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We created them, and strengthened their frame; and whenever We will, We can replace them with others like them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:28] We created them and made firm their frames, their limbs and their joints, and, whenever We will, We can completely replace them with others like them, in terms of their created form, in place of them, by destroying them (tabdīlan, ‘completely’, is for emphasis; idhā, ‘when’, functions in the sense of in, ‘if’, similar to [where God says in several places], in yasha’ yudhhibkum, If He will, He can take you away [cf. Q. 14:19]; but because He, exalted be He, has not willed this, it has not happened thus far).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We, even We, created them) i.e. the people of Mecca, (and strengthened their frame) and made their constitution strong. (And when We will, We can replace them, bringing others like them) i.e. We destroy them (in their stead) He says: if We had willed, We would have destroyed these sinful and disbelieving people and brought instead of them people who are better and more obedient.
